remarks: Euclid's axiom.  Take an angle ` B A C ` and a point ` D ` between ` B ` and ` C ` .  Now, if you extend the segment ` A D ` to a point ` T ` , then ` T ` lies between two points ` x ` and ` y ` that lie on the angle.  Axiom A10 of [Schwabhauser] p. 13.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 9-Sep-2013.)
statement:
axeuclid $p |- ( ( N e. NN /\ ( A e. ( EE ` N ) /\ B e. ( EE ` N ) /\ C e. ( EE ` N ) ) /\ ( D e. ( EE ` N ) /\ T e. ( EE ` N ) ) ) -> ( ( D Btwn <. A , T >. /\ D Btwn <. B , C >. /\ A =/= D ) -> E. x e. ( EE ` N ) E. y e. ( EE ` N ) ( B Btwn <. A , x >. /\ C Btwn <. A , y >. /\ T Btwn <. x , y >. ) ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d C x y $.
$d D x y $.
$d N x y $.
$d T x y $.
